answers.answer: First to clarify PCOS and Ovarian cancer. They are two very separate things.  Ovarian cancer is usually not diagnosed without  a pathology report of tissue removed during surgery.  Chemo is used to treat Ovarian cancer, Metformin and other drugs are used to treat PCOS.  A concerted effort to lose weight will benifit the Diabetus and the High Blood pressure. Metformin is also used in the control of blood sugars in Diabetus.  Unless there is more that you are not saying, a regiment of chemo for PCOS is not understood .

I can help a little with the PCOS - my neice has it - but I dont understand the DX of OC either. Who said you had OC, have you had surgery, what stage is it? I am really lost on this one. I have noticed lately a few woman have said they have stage 4 OC prior to surgery, there was a simlar post the other day!Anna X

For once Anna we are on the same page, I was thinking back to when Leslee called me the day she came from the doctors office, getting the results of all her tests up to that time, The TVS, MRI, Colonoscopy, CA125 and a good old fashioned vaginal, palpatation of the abdomen, she told me, "I have ovarian cancer",  This was all visulized and felt externally and internally, a CA125 of 876,  But it was not until a few days later after surgery when the staging results were told to us.  A 4 1/2#  tumor should have been felt earlier by just  a knowledgeable pair of doctors hands.  Was it wrong for her GYN to tell her she had cancer without a path report? I don't think so, it put us into high gear for action ASAP.  OVCA may whisper but it was yelling at us by then.

question: I am trying to understand what 6 cycles of 3 weeks each means and if it possible to continue working while receiving Chemo? Let me tell you a little about my situation. title: Trying to understand Chemo
